review: One of the best electronics purchases ever! The ability to just plug this thing in and be able to watch Netflix/Youtube while using my phone as a remote control is almost magical, and this is coming from a tech guy. Mirroring almost any tab from Chrome is also a really neat feature if you want to watch a video from a website that is not supported natively by ChromeCast, such as Amazon or Vimeo.I wish more applications supported ChromeCast but hopefully the situation will continue improving in the future. Still for $35 I would give this product 6 stars if I could.

review: I bought this as a cheap way to stream Netflix, Hulu and Plex. There are some performance issues with Netflix sometimes, not sure if it's the device or ISP. I have to say the mobile apps tend to work much better than "chromcasting" from my laptop browser. Mostly because with the mobile devices(iphone, ipad), we can set-up a stream and then use the device to do something else(yup, multi-screen entertainment, welcome to the new millenium). The laptop you have to set it up in the browser then full-screen to get full screen on the TV. I'm forgetting now if that's Hulu or Netflix.I don't have the plex app on my phone, so I also cast that directly from the browser. As a result I loose some of the fun functionality of the Plex Media Player, but it works fine.Overall I'd say "it works fine" is a good description. And for that price, I'd say that's pretty good.
author: claybob

review: I LOVE my Chromecast and give it 5 stars! Set up was a piece of cake!  Anybody could do it! I am able to essentially turn my TV into a Smart TV. I can use my iPad, iPhone, or laptop to control whatever I am watching (pause, play, etc.) But you can still use your device to do other things when you are watching something on Netflix, etc. The $35 price point was also a plus!!!
